intro: Licania micrantha subsp. micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered licania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, flat seeds.
